title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: このビネットは、sistatica パッケージで提供される 4 種類の一要因デザインについて、オムニバス検定と事後検定（ペア比較）を実行する際の、パッケージ固有の仕様・引数・出力の読み方をまとめます。

previous_headings: 0. イントロダクション
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: library(sistatica) library(dplyr) library(magrittr)

id: 入力データ形式ロング形式
previous_headings: 0. イントロダクション
what: 0.2 入力データ形式（ロング形式）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 本パッケージは、全て ロング形式のデータを前提とします。 反復測定 / Friedman: dv（数値）, within（条件）, id（被験者ID） Welch / Kruskal-Wallis: dv（数値）, group（群）

previous_headings: 0. イントロダクション
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 事後検定の返り値には、視覚的な便宜のために p_adj_mark 列が含まれます。 p_adj < 0.05 のとき "*" それ以外（および p_adj が NA）は ""（空文字） ※ 有意水準 0.05 は固定仕様です。

id: p値補正とci補正の扱い独立
previous_headings: 0. イントロダクション
what: 0.4 p値補正とCI補正の扱い（独立）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 事後検定では、p値補正と効果量CI補正は 独立です。 p値補正: p_adjust_method（推奨例: "holm"） CI補正: ci_adjust_method（推奨例: "bonferroni"、選択肢は "none", "bonferroni", "sidak"） この独立性のため、例えばp_adj < 0.05（有意）だが ci_low_adj〜ci_high_adj が 0 を含む、のような 不一致が起こりえます。これはバグではなく、異なる誤差制御戦略を併用した帰結です。 本ビネットでは、推奨例として常に以下を用います。 p_adjust_method = "holm" ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni" なお、CI補正は その関数が返すペア数（比較数）に基づいて行われます。

previous_headings: 0. イントロダクション
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: missing は "pairwise"（デフォルト）と "complete_case" を持ちます。 "pairwise": 行単位で dv/within/id の欠損を除いた後、効果量とCIは 各ペアで両条件が揃うIDのみを用いて計算します。 "complete_case": 全条件にわたって欠損のないID（完全ブロック）のみで分析します。 実質的にどちらも「欠損行を落とす」挙動になりやすいですが、APIとして引数は残しています。

id: 重複セルidwithinの扱い対応ありの事後検定
previous_headings: 0. イントロダクション
what: 0.6 重複セル（ID×within）の扱い（対応ありの事後検定）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 対応あり（rm_posthoc(), friedman_posthoc()）では、id × within セルが重複するデータに対し、次の選択肢があります。 duplicate = "mean"（デフォルト）: 各参加者（id）が各条件（within）で複数回測定されているデータは、いったん「参加者×条件」に1値へ集約（平均値を使用）してから、通常の一要因・反復測定として解析されます。 duplicate = median" / "first": 中央値で集約する、あるいはデータ内で最初に登場する値を使う。 duplicate = "error"（デフォルト）: 重複があれば停止 duplicate = "first" かつ duplicate_na_rm = TRUE の場合は、重複セル内の NA を除いてから最初の値（first non-NA）を取ります。

id: この手法での採用方法本パッケージの設計
previous_headings: 1. パラメトリック・対応あり（反復測定分散分析）
what: 1.1 この手法での採用方法（本パッケージの設計）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 効果量: GES（generalized eta-squared） 効果量: dz（Cohen’s d paired / repeated measures） 効果量CI: effectsize::repeated_measures_d(method="z") による解析的CI p値補正 / CI補正は独立（イントロ参照）

id: データロング形式の既存データセット
previous_headings: 1. パラメトリック・対応あり（反復測定分散分析）
what: 1.2 データ（ロング形式の既存データセット）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: ここでは datasets::CO2 を用います（ロング形式、Plant がID、conc が within）。
code: dat_rm = datasets::CO2 %>%   dplyr::mutate(     Plant = factor(Plant),     conc = factor(conc)   )  # 必要に応じて、対象列だけを残す（他の列があっても本関数は問題なく動作） dat_rm_small = dat_rm %>%   dplyr::select(Plant, conc, uptake)

previous_headings: 1. パラメトリック・対応あり（反復測定分散分析）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: rm_omni = rm_anova_omnibus(   data = dat_rm_small,   dv = uptake,   within = conc,   id = Plant,   missing = "pairwise" )

previous_headings: 1. パラメトリック・対応あり（反復測定分散分析） > 1.3 オムニバス（rm_anova_omnibus()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: statistic_type / statistic / df1 / df2 / p がオムニバス検定 effect_size_type = "ges" と effect_size が GES missing, n_obs, n_id はデータ処理の要約 （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: rm_omni %>% dplyr::select(term, statistic, df1, df2, p, effect_size, effect_size_type, n_id, missing)

previous_headings: 1. パラメトリック・対応あり（反復測定分散分析）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: rm_post = rm_posthoc(   data = dat_rm_small,   dv = uptake,   within = conc,   id = Plant,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   missing = "pairwise",   duplicate = "mean" )

previous_headings: 1. パラメトリック・対応あり（反復測定分散分析） > 1.4 事後（rm_posthoc()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: group1, group2 がペア p と p_adj、および p_adj_mark 効果量: effect_size_type = "dz" と effect_size 未補正: ci_low, ci_high（ci_level） 補正: ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj（ci_level_adj, ci_adjust_method） n_pair はそのペアで効果量・CIに使えた対応データ数 （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: rm_post %>%   dplyr::select(group1, group2, p_adj, p_adj_mark, effect_size, ci_low, ci_high, ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj, n_pair) %>%   dplyr::arrange(p_adj)

id: この手法での採用方法本パッケージの設計-1
previous_headings: 2. パラメトリック・対応なし（Welch分散分析）
what: 2.1 この手法での採用方法（本パッケージの設計）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 効果量: omega²（WelchのFと自由度から計算した近似値） 効果量: Hedges’ g（pooled_sd = FALSE） 効果量CI: effectsize::hedges_g(pooled_sd = FALSE) の解析的CI p値補正 / CI補正は独立（イントロ参照）

id: データ既存データセット
previous_headings: 2. パラメトリック・対応なし（Welch分散分析）
what: 2.2 データ（既存データセット）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: ここでは datasets::PlantGrowth を用います（ロング形式）。
code: dat_welch = datasets::PlantGrowth %>%   dplyr::mutate(group = factor(group)) %>%   dplyr::rename(y = weight)

previous_headings: 2. パラメトリック・対応なし（Welch分散分析）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: welch_omni = welch_anova_omnibus(   data = dat_welch,   dv = y,   group = group,   missing = "pairwise" )  invisible(welch_omni)

previous_headings: 2. パラメトリック・対応なし（Welch分散分析） > 2.3 オムニバス（welch_anova_omnibus()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: Welchの F と近似自由度（df1, df2）と p Welch ANOVA に対する omega² は便宜的に提供される近似であり、厳密な等分散前提のomega²と同一視しない（パッケージの注記）。 （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: welch_omni %>% dplyr::select(term, statistic, df1, df2, p, effect_size, effect_size_type)

previous_headings: 2. パラメトリック・対応なし（Welch分散分析）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: welch_post = welch_posthoc(   data = dat_welch,   dv = y,   group = group,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   missing = "pairwise" )  invisible(welch_post)

previous_headings: 2. パラメトリック・対応なし（Welch分散分析） > 2.4 事後（welch_posthoc()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: group1, group2 がペア p_adj と p_adj_mark 効果量: effect_size_type = "hedges_g" と effect_size CI（未補正／補正）と ci_adjust_method （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: welch_post %>%   dplyr::select(group1, group2, p_adj, p_adj_mark, effect_size, ci_low, ci_high, ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj) %>%   dplyr::arrange(p_adj)

id: この手法での採用方法本パッケージの設計-2
previous_headings: 3. 非パラメトリック・対応あり（フリードマン検定）
what: 3.1 この手法での採用方法（本パッケージの設計）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 効果量: Kendall’s W（W = chi^2 / (n*(k-1))） 事後検定: 対応のある Wilcoxon（符号付順位）のペア比較（rstatix） 効果量: rank-biserial correlation（paired = TRUE） 効果量CI: effectsize::rank_biserial(paired=TRUE) の解析的CI p値補正 / CI補正は独立（イントロ参照） オムニバスは unreplicated complete block を要求（重複は停止） 事後は duplicate で集約可能

id: データ既存データセット-1
previous_headings: 3. 非パラメトリック・対応あり（フリードマン検定）
what: 3.2 データ（既存データセット）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 反復測定と同様に datasets::CO2 を用い、within = conc, id = Plant とします。
code: dat_fr = datasets::CO2 %>%   dplyr::mutate(     Plant = factor(Plant),     conc = factor(conc)   ) %>%   dplyr::select(Plant, conc, uptake)

previous_headings: 3. 非パラメトリック・対応あり（フリードマン検定）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: fr_omni = friedman_omnibus(   data = dat_fr,   dv = uptake,   within = conc,   id = Plant,   missing = "pairwise" )  invisible(fr_omni)

previous_headings: 3. 非パラメトリック・対応あり（フリードマン検定） > 3.3 オムニバス（friedman_omnibus()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: statistic_type = "chi_squared" と statistic, df, p 効果量: effect_size_type = "kendalls_W" と effect_size （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: fr_omni %>% dplyr::select(term, statistic, df, p, effect_size, effect_size_type)

previous_headings: 3. 非パラメトリック・対応あり（フリードマン検定）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: fr_post = friedman_posthoc(   data = dat_fr,   dv = uptake,   within = conc,   id = Plant,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   missing = "pairwise",   duplicate = "mean" )  invisible(fr_post)

previous_headings: 3. 非パラメトリック・対応あり（フリードマン検定） > 3.4 事後（friedman_posthoc()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: p_adj と p_adj_mark 効果量: effect_size_type = "rank_biserial" と effect_size CI（未補正／補正）と n_pair （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: fr_post %>%   dplyr::select(group1, group2, p_adj, p_adj_mark, effect_size, ci_low, ci_high, ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj, n_pair) %>%   dplyr::arrange(p_adj)

id: この手法での採用方法本パッケージの設計-3
previous_headings: 4. 非パラメトリック・対応なし（クラスカル・ウォリス検定）
what: 4.1 この手法での採用方法（本パッケージの設計）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: 効果量: eta²（H-based）（rstatix の kruskal_effsize() による） 事後検定: Dunn検定（rstatix） 効果量: rank-biserial correlation（paired = FALSE） 効果量CI: effectsize::rank_biserial(paired=FALSE) の解析的CI p値補正 / CI補正は独立（イントロ参照）

id: データ既存データセット-2
previous_headings: 4. 非パラメトリック・対応なし（クラスカル・ウォリス検定）
what: 4.2 データ（既存データセット）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: Welchと同様に datasets::PlantGrowth を用います。
code: dat_kw = datasets::PlantGrowth %>%   dplyr::mutate(group = factor(group)) %>%   dplyr::rename(y = weight)

previous_headings: 4. 非パラメトリック・対応なし（クラスカル・ウォリス検定）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: kw_omni = kruskal_omnibus(   data = dat_kw,   dv = y,   group = group,   missing = "pairwise" )  invisible(kw_omni)

previous_headings: 4. 非パラメトリック・対応なし（クラスカル・ウォリス検定） > 4.3 オムニバス（kruskal_omnibus()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: statistic_type = "H" と statistic, df, p 効果量: effect_size_type = "eta2_H" と effect_size （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: kw_omni %>% dplyr::select(term, statistic, df, p, effect_size, effect_size_type)

previous_headings: 4. 非パラメトリック・対応なし（クラスカル・ウォリス検定）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
code: kw_post = kruskal_posthoc(   data = dat_kw,   dv = y,   group = group,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   missing = "pairwise" )  invisible(kw_post)

previous_headings: 4. 非パラメトリック・対応なし（クラスカル・ウォリス検定） > 4.4 事後（kruskal_posthoc()）
title: sistatica: 4種類の一要因デザインに対するオムニバス検定と事後検定
text: group1, group2 p_adj と p_adj_mark 効果量: effect_size_type = "rank_biserial" と effect_size CI（未補正／補正）と ci_adjust_method （確認用の操作例：本ビネットでは実行しません）
code: kw_post %>%   dplyr::select(group1, group2, p_adj, p_adj_mark, effect_size, ci_low, ci_high, ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj) %>%   dplyr::arrange(p_adj)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hiroyuki Tsuda. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tsuda H (2026). sistatica: Convenient Tools Tidy Statistical Analysis. R package version 0.2.0, https://tsuda16k.github.io/sistatica/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sistatica: Convenient Tools for Tidy Statistical Analysis},   author = {Hiroyuki Tsuda},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://tsuda16k.github.io/sistatica/}, }

what: Convenient Tools for Tidy Statistical Analysis
title: Convenient Tools for Tidy Statistical Analysis
text: 統計分析用のさまざまな関数を提供するパッケージです。 リファレンスページはこちら。https://tsuda16k.github.io/sistatica/

title: Convenient Tools for Tidy Statistical Analysis
text: 以下の手順でインストールできます。 もしpakパッケージをまだインストールしていない場合ははじめにそれをインストールしてください。
code: install.packages("pak") pak::pak("tsuda16k/sistatica")

title: Convenient Tools for Tidy Statistical Analysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(sistatica) ## basic example code

what: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
title: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
text: Performs omnibus Friedman test one-factor within-subject design returns Kendall's W.

title: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
code: friedman_omnibus(   data,   dv,   within,   id,   missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case") )

title: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
text: data data.frame long format. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. within Within-subject factor. Unquoted name string. id Subject identifier. Unquoted name string. missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case".

title: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
text: one-row tibble (omnibus schema). Columns: design: Design label ("nonparametric_within"). method: Omnibus method label ("friedman"). term: Name within-subject factor (tested term). statistic_type: Type omnibus test statistic ("chi_squared"). statistic: Omnibus test statistic value (\(\chi^2\)). df1: Always NA test (reserved column). df2: Always NA test (reserved column). df: Degrees freedom Friedman test (k - 1). p: Omnibus p-value. effect_size: Effect size value (Kendall's W). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("kendalls_W"). missing: Missing-data strategy used ("pairwise" "complete_case"). n_obs: Number rows (observations) used row-wise filtering (enforcing complete blocks). n_id: Number complete IDs (blocks) used Friedman test enforcing complete cases.

title: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
text: **Test**: Friedman test.  **Requirement**: unreplicated complete block design.  **Statistic**: Chi-squared df = k - 1.  **Effect size**: Kendall's W computed \(W = \chi^2 / (n (k - 1))\). Implementation note: function stops duplicated ID x within cells detected. check, wide ID x within matrix built using tapply(...) mean aggregation function. duplicates ruled , cell effectively single value; using mean simple stable way map long data wide matrix without introducing extra dependencies complicated reshaping logic. Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" "complete_case" enforce complete blocks omnibus   test keeping complete rows wide matrix.

title: Friedman test (omnibus) with Kendall's W — friedman_omnibus
code: dat = datasets::CO2 %>%   dplyr::filter(Type == "Quebec", Treatment == "chilled") %>%   dplyr::mutate(conc = factor(conc))  friedman_omnibus(dat, dv = uptake, within = conc, id = Plant) #> # A tibble: 1 × 14 #>   design          method term  statistic_type statistic   df1   df2    df      p #>   <chr>           <chr>  <chr> <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 nonparametric_… fried… conc  chi_squared         16.1    NA    NA     6 0.0130 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, missing <chr>, #> #   n_obs <dbl>, n_id <dbl>

what: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
title: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
text: Performs pairwise post-hoc comparisons one-factor within-subject design using paired Wilcoxon signed-rank tests via rstatix::pairwise_wilcox_test(). Also computes rank-biserial correlation (paired) unadjusted adjusted CIs.

title: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
code: friedman_posthoc(   data,   dv,   within,   id,   conf_level = 0.95,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = c("bonferroni", "none", "sidak"),   missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case"),   duplicate = c("mean", "median", "first", "error"),   duplicate_na_rm = TRUE )

title: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
text: data data.frame long format. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. within Within-subject factor. Unquoted name string. id Subject identifier. Unquoted name string. conf_level Confidence level unadjusted effect-size CIs (default: 0.95). p_adjust_method P-value adjustment method passed rstatix (default: "holm"). ci_adjust_method CI multiplicity adjustment method (default: "bonferroni"). missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case". duplicate handle duplicated ID x within cells: "mean" (default), "median", "first", "error". duplicate_na_rm Logical; TRUE, removes NAs within duplicated cells aggregation (default: TRUE).

title: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
text: tibble one row per pairwise comparison. Columns: design: Design label ("nonparametric_within"). method: Post-hoc method label ("paired_wilcox"). term: Name within-factor. group1, group2: Level names pairwise comparison. statistic_type: Type test statistic ("W"). statistic: Wilcoxon test statistic (may NA depending rstatix output/version). df: Always NA post-hoc method package. p: Unadjusted p-value. p_adj: Adjusted p-value (according p_adjust_method). p_adj_mark: "*" p_adj < 0.05, otherwise "" (including NA). p_adjust_method: p-value adjustment method used. effect_size: Effect size estimate (rank-biserial correlation; paired). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("rank_biserial"). ci_level: Confidence level used unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_low, ci_high: Lower/upper bounds unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_adjust_method: Method used adjust effect-size CIs. ci_level_adj: Adjusted CI level implied ci_adjust_method number comparisons. ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj: Lower/upper bounds adjusted effect-size CI. n_pair: Number paired observations used effect size/CIs (complete pairs two levels). missing: Missing-data strategy used.

title: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
text: **Post-hoc test**: paired Wilcoxon signed-rank tests.  **Effect size**: rank-biserial via effectsize::rank_biserial(paired = TRUE).  **P-value adjustment**: p_adjust_method (default: "holm").  **CI adjustment**: controlled ci_adjust_method (independent p-value adjustment); supported: "none", "bonferroni", "sidak". Important note independence p-adjustment CI-adjustment: See rm_posthoc detailed explanation. note applies . Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" (default):   p-values computed removing rows missing DV/within/id; effect sizes/CIs use IDs   complete two compared within-levels. "complete_case": Restricts IDs complete across within-levels. Duplicated ID x within cells duplicated ID x within cells exist, set duplicate aggregate values within cell. Aggregation reported via single warning (via return columns). Meaning duplicate_na_rm duplicate="first": duplicate="first" duplicate_na_rm=TRUE, NAs within duplicated cell removed taking first value (.e., first non-missing value used).

title: Friedman post-hoc comparisons (paired Wilcoxon) with rank-biserial and CIs — friedman_posthoc
code: dat = datasets::CO2 %>%   dplyr::mutate(     Plant = factor(Plant),     conc = factor(conc)   )  friedman_posthoc(   dat,   dv = uptake,   within = conc,   id = Plant,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   missing = "complete_case" ) #> # A tibble: 21 × 23 #>    design      method term  group1 group2 statistic_type statistic    df       p #>    <chr>       <chr>  <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>              <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 nonparamet… paire… conc  95     175    W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #>  2 nonparamet… paire… conc  95     250    W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #>  3 nonparamet… paire… conc  95     350    W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #>  4 nonparamet… paire… conc  95     500    W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #>  5 nonparamet… paire… conc  95     675    W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #>  6 nonparamet… paire… conc  95     1000   W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #>  7 nonparamet… paire… conc  175    250    W                      1    NA 9.77e-4 #>  8 nonparamet… paire… conc  175    350    W                      1    NA 9.77e-4 #>  9 nonparamet… paire… conc  175    500    W                      1    NA 9.77e-4 #> 10 nonparamet… paire… conc  175    675    W                      0    NA 4.88e-4 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # ℹ 14 more variables: p_adj <dbl>, p_adj_mark <chr>, p_adjust_method <chr>, #> #   effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, ci_level <dbl>, ci_low <dbl>, #> #   ci_high <dbl>, ci_adjust_method <chr>, ci_level_adj <dbl>, #> #   ci_low_adj <dbl>, ci_high_adj <dbl>, n_pair <dbl>, missing <chr>

title: Kruskal-Wallis test (omnibus) with eta-squared (H-based) — kruskal_omnibus
text: Performs omnibus Kruskal-Wallis test using rstatix::kruskal_test() computes H-based eta-squared using rstatix::kruskal_effsize().

title: Kruskal-Wallis test (omnibus) with eta-squared (H-based) — kruskal_omnibus
code: kruskal_omnibus(data, dv, group, missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case"))

title: Kruskal-Wallis test (omnibus) with eta-squared (H-based) — kruskal_omnibus
text: data data.frame. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. group Grouping factor. Unquoted name string. missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case".

title: Kruskal-Wallis test (omnibus) with eta-squared (H-based) — kruskal_omnibus
text: one-row tibble (omnibus schema). Columns: design: Design label ("nonparametric_between"). method: Omnibus method label ("kruskal_wallis"). term: Name grouping factor (tested term). statistic_type: Type omnibus test statistic ("H"). statistic: Omnibus test statistic value (H). df1: Always NA test (reserved column). df2: Always NA test (reserved column). df: Degrees freedom Kruskal-Wallis test (k - 1). p: Omnibus p-value. effect_size: Effect size value (eta-squared based H). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("eta2_H"). missing: Missing-data strategy used ("pairwise" "complete_case"). n_obs: Number rows (observations) used analysis filtering missingness. n_id: Always NA -subject designs package (reserved column).

title: Kruskal-Wallis test (omnibus) with eta-squared (H-based) — kruskal_omnibus
text: **Test**: Kruskal-Wallis.  **Statistic**: H df = k - 1.  **Effect size**: H-based eta-squared rstatix::kruskal_effsize(). Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" "complete_case" behave identically :   rows missing DV/group removed.

title: Kruskal-Wallis test (omnibus) with eta-squared (H-based) — kruskal_omnibus
code: kruskal_omnibus(datasets::PlantGrowth, dv = weight, group = group) #> # A tibble: 1 × 14 #>   design          method term  statistic_type statistic   df1   df2    df      p #>   <chr>           <chr>  <chr> <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 nonparametric_… krusk… group H                   7.99    NA    NA     2 0.0184 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, missing <chr>, #> #   n_obs <dbl>, n_id <dbl>

what: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
title: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
text: Performs pairwise post-hoc comparisons using Dunn tests via rstatix::dunn_test(), adds rank-biserial correlation (unpaired) unadjusted adjusted confidence intervals.

title: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
code: kruskal_posthoc(   data,   dv,   group,   conf_level = 0.95,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = c("bonferroni", "none", "sidak"),   missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case") )

title: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
text: data data.frame. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. group Grouping factor. Unquoted name string. conf_level Confidence level unadjusted effect-size CIs (default: 0.95). p_adjust_method P-value adjustment method passed rstatix (default: "holm"). ci_adjust_method CI multiplicity adjustment method (default: "bonferroni"). missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case".

title: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
text: tibble one row per pairwise comparison. Columns: design: Design label ("nonparametric_between"). method: Post-hoc method label ("dunn"). term: Name grouping factor. group1, group2: Level names pairwise comparison. statistic_type: Type test statistic ("Z"). statistic: Z statistic value (Dunn test). df: Always NA post-hoc method package. p: Unadjusted p-value. p_adj: Adjusted p-value (according p_adjust_method). p_adj_mark: "*" p_adj < 0.05, otherwise "" (including NA). p_adjust_method: p-value adjustment method used. effect_size: Effect size estimate (rank-biserial correlation; unpaired). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("rank_biserial"). ci_level: Confidence level used unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_low, ci_high: Lower/upper bounds unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_adjust_method: Method used adjust effect-size CIs. ci_level_adj: Adjusted CI level implied ci_adjust_method number comparisons. ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj: Lower/upper bounds adjusted effect-size CI. n_pair: Total sample size used effect size/CIs (n_x + n_y). missing: Missing-data strategy used.

title: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
text: **Post-hoc test**: Dunn tests.  **Effect size**: rank-biserial via effectsize::rank_biserial(paired = FALSE).  **P-value adjustment**: p_adjust_method (default: "holm").  **CI adjustment**: controlled ci_adjust_method (independent p-value adjustment); supported: "none", "bonferroni", "sidak". Important note independence p-adjustment CI-adjustment: See rm_posthoc detailed explanation. note applies . Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" "complete_case" behave identically :   rows missing DV/group removed.

title: Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc comparisons (Dunn) with rank-biserial and CIs — kruskal_posthoc
code: kruskal_posthoc(   datasets::PlantGrowth, dv = weight, group = group,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni" ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 23 #>   design       method term  group1 group2 statistic_type statistic    df       p #>   <chr>        <chr>  <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>              <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 nonparametr… dunn   group ctrl   trt1   Z                  -1.12    NA 0.264   #> 2 nonparametr… dunn   group ctrl   trt2   Z                   1.69    NA 0.0912  #> 3 nonparametr… dunn   group trt1   trt2   Z                   2.81    NA 0.00500 #> # ℹ 14 more variables: p_adj <dbl>, p_adj_mark <chr>, p_adjust_method <chr>, #> #   effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, ci_level <dbl>, ci_low <dbl>, #> #   ci_high <dbl>, ci_adjust_method <chr>, ci_level_adj <dbl>, #> #   ci_low_adj <dbl>, ci_high_adj <dbl>, n_pair <dbl>, missing <chr>

code: lhs %>% rhs

what: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
title: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
text: Performs omnibus test one-factor repeated-measures ANOVA (within-subject design) using rstatix::anova_test() returns tidy one-row tibble standardized omnibus schema generalized eta-squared (GES).

title: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
code: rm_anova_omnibus(   data,   dv,   within,   id,   missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case") )

title: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
text: data data.frame long format. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. within Within-subject factor. Unquoted name string. id Subject identifier. Unquoted name string. missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case".

title: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
text: one-row tibble (omnibus schema). Columns: design: Design label ("parametric_within"). method: Omnibus method label ("rm_anova"). term: Name within-subject factor (tested term). statistic_type: Type omnibus test statistic ("F"). statistic: Omnibus test statistic value (F). df1: Numerator degrees freedom F. df2: Denominator degrees freedom F. df: Single df column (always NA test; included schema consistency). p: Omnibus p-value. effect_size: Effect size value (generalized eta-squared). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("ges"). missing: Missing-data strategy used ("pairwise" "complete_case"). n_obs: Number rows (observations) used analysis filtering missingness. n_id: Number unique IDs used analysis filtering missingness.

title: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
text: **Test**: One-way repeated-measures ANOVA (within-subject).  **Statistic**: F numerator/denominator df.  **Effect size**: Generalized eta-squared (GES) computed rstatix::anova_test(effect.size = "ges"). Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" (default): Removes rows missing DV/within/id (row-wise filtering). "complete_case": row-wise filtering, keeps IDs non-missing DV values   across within-levels (complete blocks).

title: Repeated-measures ANOVA (omnibus) with generalized eta-squared — rm_anova_omnibus
code: dat = datasets::CO2 %>%   dplyr::filter(Type == "Quebec", Treatment == "chilled") %>%   dplyr::mutate(conc = factor(conc))  dat$uptake[dat$Plant == dat$Plant[1] & dat$conc == dat$conc[1]] = NA  rm_anova_omnibus(dat, dv = uptake, within = conc, id = Plant, missing = "pairwise") #> # A tibble: 1 × 14 #>   design          method term  statistic_type statistic   df1   df2    df      p #>   <chr>           <chr>  <chr> <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 parametric_wit… rm_an… conc  F                   24.3     6     6    NA 5.8e-4 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, missing <chr>, #> #   n_obs <dbl>, n_id <dbl> rm_anova_omnibus(dat, dv = uptake, within = conc, id = Plant, missing = "complete_case") #> # A tibble: 1 × 14 #>   design          method term  statistic_type statistic   df1   df2    df      p #>   <chr>           <chr>  <chr> <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 parametric_wit… rm_an… conc  F                   24.3     6     6    NA 5.8e-4 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, missing <chr>, #> #   n_obs <dbl>, n_id <dbl>

what: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
title: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
text: Performs pairwise post-hoc comparisons one-factor repeated-measures design using paired t-tests (rstatix::pairwise_t_test()), adds Cohen's \(d_z\) unadjusted multiplicity-adjusted confidence intervals.

title: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
code: rm_posthoc(   data,   dv,   within,   id,   conf_level = 0.95,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = c("bonferroni", "none", "sidak"),   missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case"),   duplicate = c("mean", "median", "first", "error"),   duplicate_na_rm = TRUE )

title: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
text: data data.frame long format. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. within Within-subject factor. Unquoted name string. id Subject identifier. Unquoted name string. conf_level Confidence level unadjusted effect-size CIs (default: 0.95). p_adjust_method P-value adjustment method passed rstatix (default: "holm"). ci_adjust_method CI multiplicity adjustment method (default: "bonferroni"). missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case". duplicate handle duplicated ID x within cells: "mean" (default), "median", "first", "error". duplicate_na_rm Logical; TRUE, removes NAs within duplicated cells aggregation (default: TRUE).

title: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
text: tibble one row per pairwise comparison. Columns: design: Design label ("parametric_within"). method: Post-hoc method label ("paired_t"). term: Name within-factor. group1, group2: Level names pairwise comparison. statistic_type: Type test statistic ("t"). statistic: Test statistic value. df: Degrees freedom (t-test). p: Unadjusted p-value pairwise test. p_adj: Adjusted p-value (according p_adjust_method). p_adj_mark: Visual marker significance based p_adj: "*" p_adj < 0.05,   otherwise "" (including p_adj NA). p_adjust_method: p-value adjustment method used. effect_size: Effect size estimate (\(d_z\)). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("dz"). ci_level: Confidence level used unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_low, ci_high: Lower/upper bounds unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_adjust_method: Method used adjust effect-size CIs ("none", "bonferroni", "sidak"). ci_level_adj: Adjusted CI level implied ci_adjust_method number comparisons. ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj: Lower/upper bounds adjusted effect-size CI. n_pair: Number paired observations used effect size/CIs (complete pairs two levels). missing: Missing-data strategy used.

title: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
text: **Post-hoc test**: paired t-tests.  **Effect size**: \(d_z\) via effectsize::repeated_measures_d(method = "z").  **P-value adjustment**: p_adjust_method (default: "holm").  **CI adjustment**: controlled ci_adjust_method (independent p-value adjustment); supported: "none", "bonferroni", "sidak". Important note independence p-adjustment CI-adjustment: P-value adjustment (p_adjust_method) CI adjustment (ci_adjust_method) independent. Therefore, possible obtain results p_adj < 0.05 (significant p-adjustment) adjusted CI (ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj) still includes 0 (vice versa), especially using different adjustment strategies (e.g., p_adjust_method="holm" ci_adjust_method="none"). software bug consequence using different error-control strategies p-values confidence intervals. Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" (default): P-values computed removing rows missing DV/within/id. Effect sizes CIs computed pairwise: comparison, IDs non-missing values     two relevant within-levels used. "complete_case": Restricts IDs complete across within-levels analysis. Duplicated ID x within cells duplicated ID x within cells exist, set duplicate aggregate values within cell. Aggregation reported via single warning (via return columns). Meaning duplicate_na_rm duplicate="first": duplicate="first" duplicate_na_rm=TRUE, NAs within duplicated cell removed taking first value (.e., first non-missing value used).

title: Repeated-measures post-hoc comparisons (paired t) with dz and CIs — rm_posthoc
code: dat = datasets::CO2 %>%   dplyr::filter(Type == "Quebec", Treatment == "chilled") %>%   dplyr::mutate(conc = factor(conc))  rm_posthoc(   dat, dv = uptake, within = conc, id = Plant,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   missing = "pairwise" ) #> # A tibble: 21 × 23 #>    design  method term  group1 group2 statistic_type statistic    df     p p_adj #>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 parame… paire… conc  95     175    t                  -3.17     2 0.087 0.696 #>  2 parame… paire… conc  95     250    t                  -7.56     2 0.017 0.291 #>  3 parame… paire… conc  95     350    t                  -6.92     2 0.02  0.303 #>  4 parame… paire… conc  95     500    t                  -7.50     2 0.017 0.291 #>  5 parame… paire… conc  95     675    t                 -12.2      2 0.007 0.133 #>  6 parame… paire… conc  95     1000   t                 -10.7      2 0.009 0.164 #>  7 parame… paire… conc  175    250    t                  -3.03     2 0.094 0.696 #>  8 parame… paire… conc  175    350    t                 -16.1      2 0.004 0.081 #>  9 parame… paire… conc  175    500    t                  -4.46     2 0.047 0.608 #> 10 parame… paire… conc  175    675    t                  -5.07     2 0.037 0.515 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # ℹ 13 more variables: p_adj_mark <chr>, p_adjust_method <chr>, #> #   effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, ci_level <dbl>, ci_low <dbl>, #> #   ci_high <dbl>, ci_adjust_method <chr>, ci_level_adj <dbl>, #> #   ci_low_adj <dbl>, ci_high_adj <dbl>, n_pair <dbl>, missing <chr>

what: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
title: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
text: Performs omnibus Welch one-way ANOVA -subject factor using rstatix::welch_anova_test(), computes omega-squared resulting F statistic degrees freedom using effectsize::F_to_omega2().

title: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
code: welch_anova_omnibus(data, dv, group, missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case"))

title: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
text: data data.frame. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. group Grouping factor. Unquoted name string. missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case".

title: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
text: one-row tibble (omnibus schema). Columns: design: Design label ("parametric_between_unequal_var"). method: Omnibus method label ("welch_anova"). term: Name grouping factor (tested term). statistic_type: Type omnibus test statistic ("F"). statistic: Omnibus test statistic value (F; Welch test). df1: Numerator degrees freedom F (Welch). df2: Denominator degrees freedom F (Welch). df: Single df column (always NA test; included schema consistency). p: Omnibus p-value. effect_size: Effect size value (omega-squared; approximation Welch F df). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("omega2"). missing: Missing-data strategy used ("pairwise" "complete_case"). n_obs: Number rows (observations) used analysis filtering missingness. n_id: Always NA -subject designs package (reserved column).

title: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
text: **Test**: Welch one-way ANOVA.  **Statistic**: F Welch-approximated df1/df2.  **Effect size**: Omega-squared computed F df via effectsize::F_to_omega2(). Note: omega-squared value computed Welch F statistic associated degrees freedom. provides convenient effect-size summary, interpreted approximation. Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" "complete_case" behave identically :   rows missing DV/group removed.

title: Welch one-way ANOVA (omnibus) with omega-squared — welch_anova_omnibus
code: welch_anova_omnibus(datasets::PlantGrowth, dv = weight, group = group) #> # A tibble: 1 × 14 #>   design           method term  statistic_type statistic   df1   df2    df     p #>   <chr>            <chr>  <chr> <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 parametric_betw… welch… group F                   5.18     2  17.1    NA 0.017 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, missing <chr>, #> #   n_obs <dbl>, n_id <dbl>

what: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
title: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
text: Performs pairwise Welch t-tests (pool.sd = FALSE) via rstatix::pairwise_t_test(), adds Hedges' g (unpooled SD) unadjusted adjusted confidence intervals.

title: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
code: welch_posthoc(   data,   dv,   group,   conf_level = 0.95,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = c("bonferroni", "none", "sidak"),   missing = c("pairwise", "complete_case") )

title: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
text: data data.frame. dv Dependent variable (numeric). Unquoted name string. group Grouping factor. Unquoted name string. conf_level Confidence level unadjusted effect-size CIs (default: 0.95). p_adjust_method P-value adjustment method passed rstatix (default: "holm"). ci_adjust_method CI multiplicity adjustment method (default: "bonferroni"). missing Missing-data strategy: "pairwise" (default) "complete_case".

title: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
text: tibble one row per pairwise comparison. Columns: design: Design label ("parametric_between_unequal_var"). method: Post-hoc method label ("welch_pairwise_t"). term: Name grouping factor. group1, group2: Level names pairwise comparison. statistic_type: Type test statistic ("t"). statistic: Test statistic value. df: Degrees freedom (Welch t-test). p: Unadjusted p-value. p_adj: Adjusted p-value (according p_adjust_method). p_adj_mark: "*" p_adj < 0.05, otherwise "" (including NA). p_adjust_method: p-value adjustment method used. effect_size: Effect size estimate (Hedges' g, unpooled SD). effect_size_type: Effect size label ("hedges_g"). ci_level: Confidence level used unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_low, ci_high: Lower/upper bounds unadjusted effect-size CI. ci_adjust_method: Method used adjust effect-size CIs. ci_level_adj: Adjusted CI level implied ci_adjust_method number comparisons. ci_low_adj, ci_high_adj: Lower/upper bounds adjusted effect-size CI. n_pair: Total sample size used effect size/CIs (n_x + n_y). missing: Missing-data strategy used.

title: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
text: **Post-hoc test**: Welch t-tests (unpooled SD).  **Effect size**: Hedges' g via effectsize::hedges_g(pooled_sd = FALSE).  **P-value adjustment**: p_adjust_method (default: "holm").  **CI adjustment**: controlled ci_adjust_method (independent p-value adjustment); supported: "none", "bonferroni", "sidak". Important note independence p-adjustment CI-adjustment: See rm_posthoc detailed explanation. note applies . Missing-data handling (missing) "pairwise" "complete_case" behave identically :   rows missing DV/group removed.

title: Welch-type post-hoc comparisons (pairwise Welch t) with Hedges' g and CIs — welch_posthoc
code: welch_posthoc(   datasets::PlantGrowth, dv = weight, group = group,   p_adjust_method = "holm",   ci_adjust_method = "bonferroni" ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 23 #>   design   method term  group1 group2 statistic_type statistic    df     p p_adj #>   <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 paramet… welch… group ctrl   trt1   t                   1.19  16.5 0.25  0.25  #> 2 paramet… welch… group ctrl   trt2   t                  -2.13  16.8 0.048 0.096 #> 3 paramet… welch… group trt1   trt2   t                  -3.01  14.1 0.009 0.028 #> # ℹ 13 more variables: p_adj_mark <chr>, p_adjust_method <chr>, #> #   effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, ci_level <dbl>, ci_low <dbl>, #> #   ci_high <dbl>, ci_adjust_method <chr>, ci_level_adj <dbl>, #> #   ci_low_adj <dbl>, ci_high_adj <dbl>, n_pair <dbl>, missing <chr>
